inn1.comm: full at off stump, pushed firmly towards mid-off and he thinks of a single before being sent back
first one past the edge, it curves nicely after pitching and Sharma is lured forward...actually missed the bat by a fair distance
on middle and off, hint of shape, defended square to point
defended to the off side
that's a lovely delivery, full outside off 84mph, and it beats the outside edge again as Rohit comes onto the front foot
a fraction shorter this time, Rohit holds his bat inside the line this time and doesn't feel for the delivery. A testing opening over from Anderson
his opening delivery slides across the left hander and Dhawan shoulders arms
short of a length outside off, not a huge amount of pace off the surface as Dhawan lets this one go through as well
this is wider outside off, not far away from being called, and for third time in the over no shot is offered
extra carry on this one, Buttler takes it above his head from a delivery that pitched quite full
very nicely bowled, just gets it a fraction straighter, starting around off stump, and it seams away from Dhawan who comes forward and the ball scoots past the edge
short of a length into the thigh pad...a maiden to start with for Woakes, too
first run on the board, from an extra, as Anderson slides down the leg side
back outside off stump, on a full length, but started a touch too wide even though it drew Rohit into lunging forward

tucked from off stump into midwicket, Dhawan starts to set off for the single but has to turn back...there's a throw at the stumps and Cook needs to produce a sharp piece of backing up to prevent overthrows
nips into the pads from a full length, sliding down the leg side
short of a length outside off, defended into the covers...no width so far from Anderson
loose shot! Back of a length, swinging and seaming away, Rohit pushing well away from his body without any footwork. That could only have brought an edge
that's much better, a lovely classical on-drive to a full delivery outside off stump and sends it whistling straight of mid-on
short of a length on middle and leg, Dhawan aims to turn it through the leg side but gets taken on the thigh pad

almost a wicket from two routes! Dhawan, firstly, edges an expansive drive very close to his stumps and the ball trickles away wide of Buttler. Rohit races up for the single, but Dhawan hasn't moved. Buttler gathers, but can't get a return to the non-striker's end in time. Was a long single on offer. Rohit was almost at Dhawan when he had to turnaround
cut firmly into the off side and well fielded by cover as he springs to his left
defended from off stump towards mid-on
a whooshy flat-footed drive outside off to a full delivery, no footwork and he's driving miles away from his body
this time he picks the gap square through the off side, dropped a fractions short and Dhawan was able to play one of his favourite square-bat shots
hint of shape into Rohit from a full length outside off, defended on the walk to the covers
shorter of a length, takes a thick edge down to third man from a defensive shot
back of a length, dropped into the off side and this time there is good understanding over the opportunity for a quick single
very full outside off, almost a yorker, dug out towards mid-off
nice delivery, full at the stumps, straightens late on Rohit as he drives and it squirts off a thick outside edge towards point
gets an inside edge into his pads as he plays back to a length delivery
full outside off, his feet are still a little stuck on concrete as he drives and the ball dribbles towards mid-on
good delivery, a yorker, Dhawan manages to jab down on it
that's a more sweetly-struck drive as he gets a good stride into the ball but picks out mid-off
goes for the cut, but the ball wasn't quite as short as he thought, gets a bottom edge into the pitch which bobbles wide of second slip
good stop by Buttler after this delivery glanced off the pad down the leg side
on off stump, Rohit squared up a little in defence but safely plays it back to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, tucked off his pads towards square leg where Ian Bell, from midwicket, dives to his left
angled into the right hander from back of a length, thuds into his thigh pad then down into the pitch
sharp single! Rohit comes forward, blocks into the off side, they hesitate over the run but Bell, coming in from cover, slips and losing his footing so can't get any power or direction in his throw
defended towards backward point
there's a release for Dhawan, a full delivery on leg stump and he's able to flick it through straight midwicket...was in the air, but well clear of the two leg-side fielders in the circle
leg stump again, but this time he deflects off the thigh guard behind square on the leg side

breakthrough! Reward for Woakes. Dhawan's difficult stay is over. A full delivery outside off, Dhawan goes for a drive and gets a thin outside edge to the keeper...that's been on the cards this morning.
on off stump, defended to the leg side
gets forward and defends to the off side

that's all over! No relief for Kohli yet. He tries to take the aggressive option, comes down the pitch to Woakes and drives powerfully on the up but straight to Cook at mid-off. What a gift for England
full at off stump, defended towards Cook at short mid-off
full and straight, worked away through square leg with a flick of the wrists
full at off stump, Rohit keen to get forward, the ball nips off the seam and is defended to the leg side
more late movement, in the air and off the seam, takes an inside edge into the pads
comes forward again and guides it, mostly, down to third man. Pretty much in control of the shot
gets a thick inside to a length delivery as he stretches onto the front foot and it rolls backward of square
shorter of length, defended to the off side
starts this too straight and swing takes it down the leg side
short of a length outside off, Rahane is on the back foot and drives nicely to backward point
traps this off an inside edge into his pads...a strangled appeal is quickly aborted behind the wicket
full at off stump, defended to the covers, the bat twisted a little in his hands
he uses his feet to come at Woakes, it's a short-of-a-length delivery so he still has to defend
onto the front foot, opens the face and places it behind point
a nice-looking drive, striding forward into the shot, but cover makes a sharp save to his left
full at the stumps, Rahane likes it there as it allows him to use his wrists to tuck it to the leg side but he finds midwicket
beaten again...driving at a full delivery outside off. Perfect line and length from Anderson. Rohit, understandably, wants to feel bat on ball
the response is a heave wide of mid-on by Rohit, pretty ugly as he swipes it away from around off stump with a load of bottom hand but he got enough bat on it
back outside off, touch shorter, left alone
full at the stumps flicked away towards fine leg, the fielder is very square so it's an easy couple
ah, that's a ripper...dispatches a full half volley between cover and mid-off with a perfect stroke. Made a lovely, sweet crack off the bat
drags the length back, outside off, angling into Rohit but he's able to leave...excellent contest
back of a length, dropped behind square on the off side with soft hands...well-judged single
nicely bowled, full on off stump, hint of swing to find the outside edge but it's played with soft hands and escapes wide of second slip towards a short third-man boundary
speared well down the leg side, that's one of the problems Jordan has and it can be more costly in ODIs were there is no leeway on wides
short of a length, angled onto Rahane, takes the thigh pad into the leg side
on off stump, defended with a perfectly straight bat back to the bowler
leg-side again, deflects off the pad fine and again the fielder is too square to prevent a second
this one offers to come back at Rahane who defends from off stump
starts with a full delivery outside off, a little floaty, driven firmly to cover
a touch shorter and a touch wider, left alone...decent carry through to Buttler
opens the face to a length delivery and guides it to third man
sweet stroke, leans on a full, straight delivery and slots it straight of mid-on for an elegant boundary. Nothing more than a push
drags the length back in response, defended square to point
defends on the back foot and gets an inside edge to the leg side
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
the fine-leg area is proving profitable, Rahane comes forward and gets a thick inside edge which races away
takes the thigh pad into the leg side
full outside off, left alone
defended to backward point

drama here! England are convinced there's a nick here. Paul Reiffel says not out. Rohit went for a huge mow through the leg side, the head lifts on the shot. England went up straight away. No evidence on Hot Spot.
comes forward again and drives to the left of mid-off
too straight and flicked off the pads down to fine leg who, this time, keeps them to a single
full on middle and off, defended back from where it came
shorter of a length, dropped into the leg side and it's a no-ball as well
he takes full advantage! It was a length delivery, pretty much what you want for a free hit, and Rohit picks it up over deep square-leg. That's a decent hit
nips into the batsman, takes an inside edge into the pad
full outside off, drives with an open face which beats backward point
just a touch full and crucially wide enough for the batsman to lay into and stroke very nicely through extra-cover, the timing was excellent
drops the length, slightly tighter to off stump, angled down to third man
wider on the crease, angled in to middle and off, pressed with the angle to mid-on
angled in too much this time and a leg side wide that we've seen rather too often from Jordan this summer
another one down leg
back on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
on target again, blocked in the crease in front of off stump
fuller, strikes the pad, loud cry for lbw but this would have slid down the leg side
around the wicket, middle and leg line, tucked to midwicket
pushed further across the batsman who flicks down to long-on
leg stump again, this is worked out to deep midwicket
touch shorter, midwicket found once again
looking for long-on finds the bowler
touch short, back foot push to long-off this time
full just outside off, pressed up to mid-off
some width to work with, Sharma cracks it square but Morgan saves well going to his left
straighter line, dabbed into midwicket for a sharp single, Jordan tears after it and nearly takes out his own fielder in trying to throw to the non-striker's end
a little too full and this is a very pleasant drive past mid-off, more excellent timing from Rahane
adjusts the length and this is just blocked
shorter ball, Rahane nicely on top of it to push wide of backward point for an easy single
good length slides past the outside edge, Buttler can't take it and the ball escapes for a bye, nicely bowled, skidded through from Root
similar delivery met with a full blade of the bat
straighter line worked wide of short long leg
back playing a length ball up the wicket
dragged down slightly but it only costs Root a single because Anderson scrambled well from deep midwicket
Sharma gives himself a little room outside off, waits for this to slide on and cuts through point, timed it well enough to get it to the rope
floated up to middle and off, flicked down to long-on
more air and a touch wider, driven out to deep cover
back on off stump dropping this in front of point for another sharp single
floated up on the stumps, pushed down to long-on, easy runs available here
touch short and cut past point who slipped! Anderson has to chase round to his left from deep cover and they get back for two
straighter line and finds the leg side sweeper this time
full length pressed back to the bowler
dabbed to square leg, Cook races into the save the single but misfields with his right hand and they get the run anyway
pushed from the crease to the bowler's right, Root gets across to save well
full length, played slightly in-to-out for a single to long-off
nudged from off stump for another single down the ground
full length on the stumps, a well-timed flick to long-on, very easy for India here
mid-off is now up saving the single, this is pushed towards him slightly in the air, short of a chance
straighter line, whipped down to long-on to bring up the hundred
forward flicking a fuller ball to square leg
down the wicket and working this from off stump out to deep midwicket
forward on off stump to place a length ball into the gap between square leg and midwicket for a sharp single
straighter line and this is tucked out to deep midwicket
full toss outside off, pushed out to deep cover
full on off stump, pushed firmly inside mid-on so they can get an easy single
full again, this is dropped into cover for an easy single
similar delivery, this time reached out for and nicely driven wide of deep cover but not wide enough for a second
straighter line and this is just blocked into extra-cover
similar line, tried to be worked into the leg side but just finds midwicket
around the wicket now for Tredwell, middle and leg line, dropped in front of short long leg for a single
swept off leg stump to deep square
tossed up, gently blocked coming forward on middle and off
touch fuller, pressed down to long-off

a nice slider past the outside edge and Buttler goes up for a stumping, we're going upstairs. This is very close, Rahane dragged his back foot out of his ground, then rocked is back, did he do it in time? He must have something grounded behind the popping crease. If there's anything back, it is very marginal indeed. And the third umpires says it's not there, timely wicket for England, nice arm ball from Tredwell
middle and off line, blocked coming forward
firm drive from off stump to extra cover
from the crease, dropped towards point, no run available
goes for a cover drive and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
manages to steer this backward of point this time for a single
fuller length, off stump line, blocked back to the bowler
touch straight and whipped through midwicket, Bell the latest fielder to slip over which hampered his chase and he can't cut it off
length ball on the stumps blocked back to the bowler
more air, dropped wide of midwicket for an easy single
forward on off stump to press into the covers, Cook in sharply to save the single
more air, Raina reaches out to play back to the bowler
fulller ball, nudged down to long-on
straight line, full length, knocked back to the bowler
full ball angled across the left-hander who drives wide of deep cover, Anderson is sprinting in front of the pavilion and slides just in time to save four
nicely bowled, good length just outside off, held it's line and beat the outside edge, would have thought there might have been a bit more of that from the back-up seamers
similar delivery, this time Sharma stays back and manages to negate the movement and defends back to the bowler
full at the stumps, worked out to deep square and Sharma brings up his fifty in 82 balls, played a vital role for his side
length ball tight to off stump, Raina tried to run it down to third man but got an inside edge that almost found it's way back onto the stumps, ran behind square leg for a single
back of a length on off stump, dabbed from the crease to midwicket
forward blocking on off stump back to the bowler
floated up from Tredwell, batsman came down the wicket but misjudged the length, ended up very awkwardly shoves his bat at it to avoid being stumped
touch wider line, pressed into the covers
a nasty heave across the line but a decent enough connection and gets four to deep midwicket
down the wicket and misjudges a lofted drive finding mid-on along the floor
back and working this against the spin to deep square
length on the stumps, flicked down to long leg
a foot outside off on a length, Sharma stays leg side of it and chops down to third man
bumper, as is expected to Raina, well-directed, well avoided too
way down leg, by a good yard
back just outside the left-hander's off stump, trying to run a length ball down to third man finds backward point
length on leg stump, easy nick down to long leg
touch straight, back of a length, half-pulled down to long leg
off stump line, driven to extra-cover

down the wicket and a miscued lofted drive finds long-off. Tredwell strikes again, luring Sharma into trying to aim at the short straight boundaries but this connection is a thick outside edge that presented an easy chance to the fielder running a few yards off the long-off rope
back and driving into the non-striker's stumps
floated up on off stump, driven to extra-cover
back to a full ball that skidded on a little, pushes from off stump to cover
straighter line, flicked to midwicket
flicked off leg stump to fine leg
brilliant work by Morgan at backward points as he springs to his left to intercept Dhoni's cut...good support for the bowler
wide outside off, too wide...he hasn't been consistent enough today
angled into the pads and flicked to deep square to get him underway
down the leg side, another wide, another ball...not great from Jordan, struggling to adjust to the right and left handers
full outside off, driven to cover
comes forward and drives, away from his body, straight to cover again
opens the face into the off side, eventually it beats backward point and cover for a walked single
slides in from round the wicket, Raina steps back and drives to backward point
big appeal for lbw! An expansive sweep from Raina, struck him on the front pad...looked pretty close. Replays show it was smashing it leg stump
good stuff from Tredwell, comes forward and defends to cover
driven off the back foot to cover, can't beat the field again
ah, that's very nicely play, comes down the pitch on the line of leg stump which allows him to go inside-out over the off side, placing it between deep cover and long-off
pushed off the back foot to the cover sweeper
full outside off, driven to cover
wrong line, on leg stump and neatly tucked away very fine...fine leg would have struggled to cut it off even if he had been in a more conventional position
straight and worked into the square-leg area
full on off stump, Dhoni shuffles across and defends
getting right across his crease, almost outside off stump when he shovels this full delivery back to Anderson
a lazy, nothing shot as he feels away from his body without moving his feet and gets beaten
full on off stump, defended to the off side
uses his feet and drives but can't beat mid-off
another slider, Raina exposes his stumps as he steps to leg and plays to backward point with an open face
squeezes this one through a gap square of the wicket as neither short third man or backward point can cut off this off-side dab
comes down the pitch then taps to midwicket
touch short outside off, Dhoni slices it away backward of point although it wasn't timed that well
fortune for Raina, playing away from his body and gets an inside edge goes to ground and then beats Buttler to his right-hand side
there's the bouncer, over middle and leg, and he doesn't have too many problems getting underneath although he did think about pulling
a punchy on drive, Anderson tries to stick a boot out but mid-on is straight enough to cut it off
full on middle and off, defended to cover
another short one, over off stump this time, Raina sways out of the line
plays this very well, the placement is excellent, as he back-cuts wide of third man...just a bit too much width from Anderson so the over ends up costing eight
back of a length, straight, takes the pad to the leg side
worked off the stumps into midwicket
back of a length, outside off, flicked with bottom hand into midwicket
full outside off, hit-and-run from Dhoni towards mid-off...Cook's throw can't be backed-up cleanly which means there's the chance for a bonus second. Good pressure from Dhoni
nudged out through midwicket
short, but not with much venom, pulled out to deep square-leg
excellent from Raina, backs towards leg against a length delivery which opens up the off side and it threads it through an off-side field that doesn't have much space
goes straight this time and it's flicked off the pads to long leg
now Dhoni advances down on the line of off stump and whips a full delivery to deep square
short around leg stump, rolls his wrists on the pull and sends it along the ground to long leg
short of a length into Dhoni's body, he goes for a pull and it flies wide of a diving Buttler but without contact on the bat
angled down to third man
that's high and handsome! A lovely straight, lofted drive by Raina who picks up a length delivery and sends it back over Woakes' head
short and helped down to long leg which takes him to a 49-ball fifty
on a length outside off, opens the face behind point
short boundaries! This is a top edge, but it flies comfortably into the stands as Raina latches onto another short ball and hoicks it over long leg
full at the stumps, flicked through midwicket and deep square-leg has to pull off a slide to cut off another boundary
superb from Raina, full on off stump and he flicks it over straight midwicket this time with another lovely piece of timing and placement
now Dhoni pierces the off side with a textbook drive, comes forward to the full delivery and bisects backward point and cover
the pressure tells on Jordan as another one slides down the leg side
width outside off, chopped down to third man
short, around leg stump, the pitch is overly quick and Raina has time to swivel on another pull
full on middle and leg, flicked to fine leg
short, outside leg stump this time, and Jordan doesn't get away with it - his eighth wide of the innings. It's a significant issue for him.
full outside off, he comes forward and glides it down to third man
and another wide, down the leg side this time
another again, pushed way down the leg side...into double figures of wides for him
oh dear, this is a serious problem now, as another screams down the leg side and Buttler has to dive to his left. Jordan and Cook managed a smile. Through gritted teeth.
finally the over finishes, with a delivery full around off stump that nips back and brings an lbw appeal
on off stump, pushed into the covers where the fielder is quickly in
tight on off stump, pushed to the covers
full and straight, flicked to long leg
steps to leg, Anderson follows him but Raina is able to pick it over behind square on the leg side

another top edge, this time almost directly over the wicketkeeper as he pulls at a short ball...but the end result is another boundary. With such short straight boundaries maybe short isn't the best plan
oh, that's just classical as he leans into a perfect cover drive and it's another huge over for India. That was a stroke for the photo album
just full of a good length a foot outside off and Dhoni goes after it swinging just over the head of mid-off
straighter ball strikes the pads with Dhoni looking to flick to leg
full at the pads, this is flicked out through square leg
full delivery a foot outside off, pressed wide of mid-off for a quick single
full on the stumps, Dhoni powers it down the ground inside mid-on, taking on the straight fences again and getting his reward
yorker, dug out back up the wicket
first ball, Raina is down the track and posting this into the Cathedral Road stand, lovely timing, controlled stroke
forward dropping this into the covers, fielder scrambles well to save the run
more air, Raina can just block this back to the bowler
touch fuller, flicked down to long-on
around the wicket, straight line worked out to the right-hander's long-on
fired in a bit, tickled into square leg for an easy single
yorker just outside off, dug out into midwicket and they steal a quick single
forward just outside off pressing to point and they take off immediately for a run and get home easily
cracking stroke, Raina giving himself a little room outside off stump and smearing a cover drive past extra-cover, the sweeper is nowhere near this, that was smoked
full length on off stump and this is belted straight back past the bowler
better length for Stokes, strikes the pad with Raina looking to tuck this into the leg side
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man and oh dear straight through Woakes and they get runs out towards the boundary
a step to leg and flashes a cut from off stump, wasn't short at all, timed through point, just great batting that
floated up, driven steadily out to long-off
full ball driven to the bowler's right hand, good diving save
back on his stumps flicking just in front of square leg for a sharp single
full on leg stump, ran to midwicket
pressed into the leg side again and Morgan slides across to his left to make a superb save
back of a length, pulled firmly but straight to deep square
full at the pads, clipped wide of long leg for a couple
slower ball gone horribly wrong, bounces several times and goes miles down leg! That was a schoolboy delivery
went for the same ball, 66mph, a little bit too leg side, Dhoni helps it down to long leg
yorker just outside off, angled in front of point for a single
went for the yorker but it drifted down leg
full at the pads, clipped out to deep midwicket
walks across his stumps a little, goes to flick to leg, ball runs fine for two...leg byes so no century just yet
goes for the yorker, little too full, driven out wide of long-off but not wide enough for the second run

full toss outside off stump, calmly tapped out to long-on and there's his hundred in just 74 balls, what a splendid innings this has been, acceleration at the perfect time and kept it going to put his side in a great position
full at the pads, a deflection back to the bowler, Dhoni doesn't know that and sets off for a single, Jordan can run him out but misses the stumps - wide again!
yorker length, Dhoni goes to swing to leg and gets a thick inside edge that flies to third man, good fortune for the Indian captain

full on middle and leg, Dhoni goes to whip it leg side and gets it high out to square leg, Stokes runs in to try and take it and...dives over it! It runs for four, Stokes misjudged that and got nowhere near either the catch or the save
fired down leg side, Jordan has a real problem there
very full and wide of off stump, Dhoni leaves it, just inside the guidelines

full just outside off, Raina gave himself a little room and drove hard into the off side but in the air and finds deep cover. So a fantastic innings comes to an end. Another pumping stroke off the meat of the bat but straight to Anderson who took a simple catch
yorker length on off stump, driven just wide of mid-off for a quick single
full at the leg stump, runs off the pad behind square for a leg bye
slower ball, 66mph, Dhoni swings hard at it and keeps it on the ground down to long-on
back of a length going across the left-hander, Jadeja trying to cut, misses completely
excellent yorker, dug into midwicket but everyone is out on the rope so they scramble back for a second, hard luck for Woakes
full ball outside off, Dhoni swings himself off his feet in missing this
full on leg stump, whipped out to deep square
down the track to a back of a length ball, struck on the pad trying to work to leg, Anderson ensures there's no single
low full toss outside off, Jadeja swings and gets a toe-end back to the bowler
short and pulled backward of square, off high on the bat, for just a single and Dhoni is finally back on strike
swung down the ground, over mid-off who's up in the circle, didn't time it so just a couple, it plugs but Dhoni goes to fifty, played pretty well
yorker, turned out to deep midwicket, just a single
nice and full again but Dhoni manages to steer this square in the gap and they sprint back for the second

slower ball, 68mph, Woakes has given that a few goes and now it pays off, Dhoni swinging wildly to leg and being bowled. Woakes rightly pleased with that delivery, deceived the batsman and he got it on target, taking out leg stump
down the track, nudging this just wide enough of midwicket for a sharp single
full on leg stump, whipped out wide of deep midwicket for a couple
full toss but Jadeja can only get it straight back to the bowler who fields going to his left
great shot, across the stumps and a little paddle flicks a full ball from outside off to fine leg
step to leg, Jordan fired it in at the pads, just pushed to cover
full toss outside off but gets away with it, this is slapped straight to deep cover
sets himself for a swing to leg and edges a full ball fine of short third man! Really hasn't been Jordan's day, total miscue from Ashwin
drops the length slightly, Ashwin aiming big to leg again, this comes off the body to cover

and another edge runs away from Jordan's bowling, back of a length trying to swing to the off side, Buttler can't take a leaping catch but took enough sting off it to prevent it running to the third man fence

inn2.comm: neat start for Cook as he gets a delivery full on the pads and clips it through midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, flicked through square leg for another brace
gets his line outside off, full, Cook comes forward and defends to mid-off
shuffles across his crease and works a straight delivery off his pads, again backward of square and long leg can't stop the second
full outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off from the back foot and gets off the mark straight away
full, angling across outside off, left alone
beats the edge, back of a length and going across Cook who fiddles for it outside off with his feet stuck in the crease
fuller this time, outside off, left alone
hanging it outside off, Cook doesn't opt to play
a beauty! That is unplayable. Pitches short of a length on middle and off, then jags away off the seam to fly past Cook's edge...good carry, too, through to Dhoni
that's positive from Hales, another punchy back-foot drive between point and cover which gets hauled in just before the boundary
fuller and straight, flicked to mid-on
edged! But wide of second slip. Was full, Hales went for a drive, going hard at the ball, and the think edge flew quickly fine of third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
outside off, hint of seam away, left alone
more seam movement, this one comes back into Hales from outside off and is fairly close to the stumps as the batsman shoulders arms
back of a length outside off, 84mph, left alone
on the pads, 84mph, deflects down into the leg side
he gets squared up a little this time, trying to work a delivery from off stump into the leg side
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man off a controlled edge
tries to force this off the back foot, takes a thick inside edge into the leg side and after a moment of hesitation they both make the single easily
some more seam movement, nipping away from Cook as he defends it square into the off side
full outside off, shaping away, Hales leaves it alone
another one is left alone outside off
fantastic stroke, comes forward into a delivery that wasn't a half volley and drives it between cover and mid-off. Using his big stride well
bowls this a touch shorter, Hales driving again, more off the back foot, straight to cover
fuller delivery, another drive, and this time it's in the air off a thick outside but flies fine of backward point to third man
an appeal for lbw, the ball nips back into Cook who falls across his shot...maybe height? That appears the main issue. Yep, going well over the stumps
full on off stump, 85mph, Hales drives off the front foot where cover cuts it off with a dive to his right by the sub, Rayudu
short of a length at off stump, Cook crunches a pull off the front foot, he picked the length early, but slotted it straight towards mid-on
beaten again, feeling for a length delivery away from his body...the feet aren't quite in sync as yet
fuller, brings him onto the front foot and he drives to mid-off
tight to off stump, Cook chops it into the ground towards backward point
goes to pull a length delivery, doesn't make contact and the ball just bounces over middle stump
there's swing for him, but it's down the leg side so he starts with a wide
and again, this actually started quite some away outside leg stump
gets this one on the stumps, well leg at least, and it's clipped out to deep square
good length, just outside off, Hales opts to leave alone
full, angling into the pads, Hales misses his flick and there's an appeal for lbw but it's comfortably missing the stumps
good line, on off stump, no width for Hales to work with and he drives to mid-off
he's keen to drive through the off side, stays leg side of the delivery, but can only punch this back to the bowler
that's what he was trying to do, excellent shot as he picks the gap through the covers with a strong drive off the back foot...wasn't a poor delivery, but Hales manufactured the scoring chance
close with a hit! Cook cut this straight to cover, I think he thought he'd found the gap and set off straight away for the run...he was out with a direct hit
swing and a miss...full outside off, Hales tempted into another drive but is beaten by the swing
terrific pull shot this time, picked up the length early and rocks onto the back foot to help it through square leg...places it wide of the deep fielder
now he drives again! Mohit over compensates by going very full outside off, Hales then picks him off through the covers with another strong drive
back of a length, driven out to cover and Hales immediately looks at his bat
plays over the top of a wide delivery outside off, trying to cut it square
more swing, but starting on the wrong line, takes the pad towards fine leg
pushes at a full, wide delivery and gets a thick edge through where a gully would have been
beaten by the swing this time as he comes forward to drive, it wasn't a half volley, he was playing on the up
left alone outside off
whipped off the stumps in front of square on the leg side, it's a leisurely couple as deep square trots around
comes onto the front foot again, drives at a full ball around off stump which slides off a slightly skewed face wide of mid-on
the tough stay for Cook continues as he drives, gets a thick edge past the stumps but picks up a boundary down to fine leg...earlier in the season that would probably have been dragged on

that's much more like it, from scratchy or scorching in the space of a delivery as he slots away a perfect cover drive as he strides forward...everything working well for that shot: feet, head and hands
left alone outside off
some width outside off, but it's quite full and Cook's cut-drive finds backward point
defended to the covers
nice delivery, although it was quite wide and Cook was beaten as he walked into an attempt to drive
full and wide outside off, driven through point and there's a sweeper back on the boundary now
back of a length on off stump, pushed to point

breakthrough! Cook goes well across his stumps, gets struck on the back leg whipping across the line and it looks pretty straight. Richard Illingworth gives it. Replays show it pitched just outside leg
showing positive footwork straight away, getting forward then opens the face to send the ball behind point
back of a length outside off, drives off the back foot and it slides off the face to third man
cleaned up! Bell leaves a straight ball. A dream over for India. Was never a ball to leave, pitched on off stump, angled back in further and the ball smashes into the top of off stump
jags into the pads from a full length, India appeal but it's going well down leg
now he's play and misses at a delivery outside off which seams away from him
full outside off, quite wide, Hales leaves and ponders if it should have been called wide
defends a length delivery to mid-on
late movement into Hales, he may have been thinking of leaving that for a moment but he ends up angling it down to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to point
that's another lovely delivery, full on off stump, swinging away and zips past the outside edge
punched off the back foot back to the bowler
defended square into the off side
full on off stump, driven up to mid-off...good, probing stuff from Shami
close! Aiming to work a length delivery to the leg side, the seam movement straightens it on him and the leading edges flies wide of cover
top shot! A lovely back-foot punch square of the wicket, went deep in his crease and play it at the top of the bounce
back of a length on off stump, pushed firmly to mid-off
driven to the cover sweeper
full outside off, he's hanging back in the crease as he likes to do, defends to backward point
and another! Hanging back proves his downfall. This delivery nips back off a length into Root and scoots between bat and pad into middle stump. Excellent from Bhuvi.
full outside off, swing back into the left hander, defended with bat and pad together
beats the edge, Morgan feeling for it outside off as he's drawn forward by a teasing length
big appeal! Not out! The ball is doing plenty. This nips back from short of a length and strikes the top of Hales' pad through to Dhoni
full outside off, holds its line, left alone
pushed into the leg side, mid-on can't stop the single
full outside off, Morgan onto the front foot and drives to cover
more seam movement, this moves away from Morgan off a good length although he may just have held his bat inside the line
good carry through to Dhoni as Morgan shoulders arms
good length on off stump, forward press into the covers
shorter, Hales is back pushing to cover
touch shorter, goes to cut outside off and misses
fuller and a tighter line, Hales knocks it into the covers and sets off for a sharp single, Morgan is slow to react and a direct hit at the striker's end would have sent Morgan packing
good length on off stump, Morgan forward defending back to the bowler
around the wicket, full on the stumps, Morgan tickles it through square leg and they run hard for the second
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
touch shorter, just a forward defence into the cover
touch wider, not timed but driven firmly into the covers, Kohli dives to his left to defend
square slash, on the bounce to backward point who gets up well with one hand to save, Raina in there, good work
Hales across his stumps looking to work to leg, ends up hurried and can't find the gap past midwicket
a foot outside off on a good length, Hales looking to angle square but gets no proper connection, the first maiden of the innings
around the wicket, forward pushing down to long-on
back playing firmly to midwicket with the spin
quicker and fuller, driven back to the bowler
sweep, half-saved by square leg and in fact keeps it to one because deep midwicket gets around in time
back and playing up towards the bowler
fired into leg stump, tapped into midwicket for an easy single
overpitched on off stump and Morgan lays into a glorious straight drive, beautiful stroke, timing was perfect
drags the length back, Morgan shoulders arms and it was perilously close to the off stump, have to say well judged
fuller and this time Morgan decides to play, dropping this into the covers
just a touch tighter and Morgan shoulders arms
sliding across Morgan who lets it go again
forward to a delivery on a tighter line, runs this into the gully
back and pressing this down to long-on
around the wicket, angled in, just blocked up the pitch from the stumps
slashing at a wider ball, gets a bit of a top edge but safely behind square and it races to the third man fence
tighter line on a better length, Morgan just blocking this
more air and wider, Morgan only forward defending again
tighter line, pushed back up to the bowler
touch short and wide enough to force this off the back foot to deep cover
touch short from over the wicket, dabbed into square leg with the gentle turn
fuller ball, driven with an open face to point

swept off the stumps, Hales gets a top edge that loops to short long leg! Big wicket for India and Jadeja takes another ODI wicket against England. Right off the toe I think this has come, gently looping to Ashwin on the 45 on the edge of the circle, he nearly let it drift over his shoulder but held a comfortable catch in the end
firm drive first ball nearly finds short extra cover, lands just short of Kohli
shorter length and forced down to long-off
length on the stumps, played back to the bowler
just what England need, this grips and turns back to take the pad with Buttler looking to play straight
this runs straight on and Buttler knocks it to extra cover
touch straight and worked around the corner for an easy single
back blocking in front of the off stump
full length, this is played firmly down to long-off
forward flicking into the gap at square leg
back and punched to extra cover
extra cover fielding again, this time from a drive to a fuller ball

played at firmly on off stump and pops up a catch to extra cover! Oh dear England are sliding away quickly here, Jadeja again! Buttler playing forward on off stump, the ball gripped a little and spun away, taking the outer half of the bat and firm press Buttler applied sent the simplest of chances to Kohli
full on the stumps, flicked down to long-on
flicked with the turn out through square leg, chance of two is there? No Morgan decides against it
superb delivery, spins away to beat the outside edge and so close to off stump too
the skids into Morgan who drops it into midwicket for an easy single
forward on off stump, blocked firmly up on the off side
straight line, tucked just wide of short long leg
forward playing wide of midwicket but the fielder is in quickly to save the single
back on the stumps, punching this to cover
full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
touch shorter, back and Stokes flicks through square leg
this slides across Morgan who leaves it alone
full length on the stump, played back to the  bowler
fuller and Morgan can whip this to midwicket
just outside off, Morgan forward in defence
forward on middle and off blocking back to the bowler
too straight, Stokes gets a tickle on it and it runs very fine for a rare boundary
back flicking a ball from off stump to midwicket
forward, nearly done by a slider, gets it up to cover
floated up, Morgan meets it on the full and plays down to long-off
flatter, skiddier ball nearly catches Stokes out playing back
reverse sweep off the stumps, gets a top edge but this is safely over point and they charge back for a third
forward just outside off to defend up the wicket
fuller and Stokes can work this down to long-on
over the wicket, played from off stump down to long-on
fuller length, pushed to midwicket off the stumps
straighter line, worked out to deep square
reverse sweep, Stokes has nailed this backward of point, great timing
beats the inside edge on the angle, loud cry for lbw but it would have slid down
off stump line, Stokes back playing into the covers
this skids in and nearly beats the inside edge again, Stokes just about keeps it out
a little too straight and this is worked through square leg
waited for and angled through point
now Morgan has nailed a reverse sweep backward of square
similar ball but Morgan stays in the crease and plays up the wicket
fuller ball, flicked wide of short long leg for a quick single
full on off stump, Morgan plays firmly down to long-off
off stump line, Morgan trying to stay leg side of it mistimes a push into the covers
gives himself room and slaps a full ball on the stumps down the ground and it's dropped by the bowler. Very firm chance with Raina sticking up a right hand but he couldn't hold on
off stump line, Stokes rolls it back up the wicket
a touch short, Stokes back in a hurry to cut powerfully wide of deep cover
length ball punched down to long-on
tries to stay leg side again, can only find the bowler from an angled-in delivery

slog swept off the stumps, not deep midwicket out but there is a square leg who comes around to take the catch. Morgan has been purring in the last few overs but got this too far up, he was reaching for the sweep slightly, couldn't send it far enough in front of square and gave deep square a chance which he took very well
driven to extra cover, it almost carried to the fielder
full on the stumps, flicked out to deep midwicket
full but Stokes is back and pressing to extra cover off the stumps
fuller ball driven down to long-off
good length just outside off, Woakes well forward in defence
fuller ball and Woakes digs it out on the popping crease
swept off middle and leg to short long leg and they scamper a single
length a foot outside off, flicked to midwicket
straight line and Woakes can steer this wide of midwicket
a flourishing off drive to the straight deep men
waits for this outside off and dabs to short third man
down the wicket driving firmly to long-on
reverse sweep, missed it this time, not out given, it's probably outside the line, brushed the glove on the way through n'all
quick delivery on middle stump, Woakes defending in the crease
fuller and a touch wider, Woakes drives to short extra cover
down the wicket opening the face to drive to deep cover

down the wicket and fetches this out towards the deep midwicket boundary...oh what a catch! Held right on the edge of the rope, Stokes looked to have absolutely whacked all of that but just tugged it a little, the fielder set himself, and reaching behind him going to his right takes the catch with his hands over the rope but the feet safely in play, great catch
full delivery, played firmly down to long-on
forward on off stump blocking into the covers
whipped through midwicket off the back foot
straight and plumb! Trapped on the back foot. The ball skids through a bit. Jordan could have walked for that one
round the wicket, full, driven to cover
drops it a touch short, cut out to the cover sweeper
pushed into the off side
bunted down to long-on
full and straight, driven hard into the pitch and it bounces back to the bowler in his followthrough
driven in the air just wide of a diving cover, the sweeper comes around to tidy up
dropped, a short ball is pulled, very firmly, to midwicket who can't hold on. Rohit the culprit
full and driven firmly to mid-off
that's a clean pick-up, fetches a length delivery from around off stump and launches it over wide long-on
a more ugly swipe this time, loses his shape on the shot as he goes to drive and clubs the ball to the leg side
worked through the leg side, Dhawan quickly in from long-on to prevent the second
turns into Tredwell who flicks to the leg side but the ball only comes off pad

big spin! That's a lovely delivery. Another England batsman left groping at spin. This one really gripped around off stump, spun sharply away, Woakes had dragged out of his crease and it was a simple stumping for Dhoni
more spin, but it turns down the leg side...bounce, too
he brings out the slog sweep, connects well from outside off and sends it powerfully through square leg
comes round the wicket, flicked through midwicket to keep the strikes
worked off the stumps out to deep midwicket
driven to cover
drifts into leg stump and is tucked into the leg side
pushed into midwicket
another powerful slog sweep, in the air this time, and it then plugs in the outfield just short of the boundary...a nice shot into the green by Anderson, bit of back spin
worked out to deep square
now it's Tredwell's turn...takes this from outside off and slog sweeps over deep square-leg. Cleanly struck.
quicker and flatter, defended
pushed to the leg side
swept again, out to deep square
now it's the reverse sweep, it comes off the middle but goes straight to short third man
a big swipe this time, takes an inside edge to the leg side
it's all over! Another sweep brings a fat top edge that loops towards midwicket. Ashwin makes it seven wickets for spin the innings.
